text.text_translated: People have been painting and writing on walls for a very long time. In prehistoric times, for example, people in Africa and Europe painted pictures of animals and people in caves. Graffiti, which is writing or drawing on walls in public places, has been found on buildings at very old sites in Greece, Italy, Syria and Iraq. In the Roman town of Pompeii, archaeologists have found many examples of this writing in Latin, and these messages included religious, political and romantic ideas, as well as some magic spells.
